title.narrative: ICIS - Improving Investment Climate & InstituionalStrenghtening in BiH

description.narrative: Reforming inspections and development of interoperability IT system that would allow better functionality of inspections and their related services.
Reforming inspections and development of interoperability IT system that would allow better functionality of inspections and their related services.

The goal of the Project is to improve investment climate and reduce costs and risks of conducting business in BiH. The objective is to be achieved through further improving the inspection system while devoting special attention to areas such as risk-based inspections and checklists; improving inspection transparency and predictability; market surveillance, veterinary, and food safety inspections. Further streamlining and reorganizing inspections in accordance with EU requirements; providing for interoperability inspection system needed to carry out risk-based inspections, data and information exchange. The Project aims at improving quality infrastructure and the inspection system and to bring inspections closer to EU practices. The Project aims at speeding up business registration and at developing an action plan to reform the bankruptcy processes.

participating-org.narrative: IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The final results have been reported on in two reports, one implementation completion and result report from the World Bank and a Final Poject Report from the RS PIU, both received in the beginning of December 2018 (although the first was dated September). The World Bank report was unsatisfactorily compiled, with a lot of documentation of intentions with the different components, but less on actual result reporting and analysis. The result report from RS was however excellent. The project had 5 components, out of which the first three (client executed) dealt with aspects of improving the businesses climate and operation, through improving the work of government institutions, while the fourth dealt with project implementation and the last was TA services provided (and executed) by the World Bank. They had the following results; 1. Establishment of a "interoperable information system" (IIS) to enable electronic data exchange between institutions; The IIS as established, did not reach the target of 20 connected institutions. At end of activty period, the number was 14. However, the establishment of the IIS is still a positive result in itself as more institutions easily can connect. Setting up joint data or IT systems between institutions on the different levels of government was initially met with scepticism and reluctance. 2. Inspection reform by upgrading quality infrastructure by working with inspection bodies. Procedures for inspections (separate for the RS and FB&H Inspectorates) was established for the following areas – Food Safety, Veterinary, Market, Sanitary, Health and Agricultural Inspection, in accordance with EU practices. An inspector certification system was established in the FB&H Inspectorate. 3. Redesign procedures for business entry and exit through i) eliminating unnecessary pre-registration requirements and documentation ii) upgrading of technical capacity of registration courts to comply with existing laws iii) harmonizing laws at the Entity level iv) streamlining of post-registration requirements. 4. Capacity building in procurement, project implementation and financial management within Inspectorates. 5. Technical Assistance; A number of studies were carried out such as i) an assessment and analysis of the current regulations and legal framework in institutions from state and federal level and ii) identification of technical specifications of equipment through a number of contracts. Several extensions of the activity period had to be carried out, mainly because of the slow start. One of the highlights of the Projects is the excellent cooperation between the RS and the Federation of B&H Inspectorates, especially in joint procurements, but also in all other matters, such as exchange of information and experience. Both IIS and institutional capacity strengthening services were procured jointly by implementing institutions from both entities. Although it took time, it was positive since it made the services procured unified instead of fragmented and different between different levels. Necessary for functioning services, and also a good experience for the involved institutions to have as an example of sucessful cooperation. The positive experiences from the IIS also inspired FBiH to set up a Border Management Information System which is a good example of government e-services, and reduces time spent on border controls of freight trucks. Allows businesses to pre-register when, what, how much, and in which vehicle goods are being transported across the border.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
